name: Damped, periodically driven pendulum (non-chaotic regime)
equations: d2θ/dt2 + β dθ/dt + (g/L) sin θ = A cos(ω t)
description_simple: A pendulum with friction and periodic forcing, in a parameter regime where trajectories settle into a regular periodic motion.
description_complex: A nonlinear second-order dynamical system describing a pendulum subject to damping and periodic external torque. For moderate forcing amplitude and sufficient damping, trajectories converge to a stable periodic orbit synchronized with the driving force. In this regime, the system is deterministic but non-chaotic, with no strange attractor, no positive Lyapunov exponent, and predictable long-term behavior.
